column4: Can anyone help with my gutsy machine that now will not boot up.  I get the error message "Starting up...  [1.080000] Kernel panic - not syncing: VPS: Unable to mount root fs on unknown-block(0,0)
I am not the only one who uses it, but I am guessing it was after an update
Could you boot into the rescue cd and pastebin menu.lst/ grub.conf?
have you chrooted in your environment already?
how do you chroot your environment?
first make sure the drive with ubuntu on it is mounted
does it show up on your desktop?
ok. now in a terminal type: sudo chroot /media/disk /bin/bash
could you type my name before you say something to me? that'll make it easier to see you in the see of comments. You can use tab to autocomplete my name
now in a terminal type: update-grub -y
it has some problems with permission denied and "cannot determine root device, this error is probably caused by an invalid /etc/fstab"
